nations.name: Commonwealth of the Westrealms
nations.description: Post-Collapse successor polity inspired by the old Commonwealth of Australia but distinct from it.

nations.name: Holy Covenanted Imperial Dominion of the Ryenarkians
nations.description: Feudal polity in the higher Drezbaeryn river system ruled by the Anointed High Emperor Darian the Smiter.

nations.name: Sidentius
nations.description: Western civilization formed by Ryenarkian proto-ancestors who followed the reincarnation of Luyid to Tuwinbin.

nations.name: O’Ryentari
nations.description: Eastern Ryenarkian civilization formed by followers of Izwar in the Khuljin region.

nations.name: The Gappe
nations.description: City-state beyond the Virgin Bush, major grain exporter to the Commonwealth.

nations.name: Halphadite Khanate
nations.description: Warband-based polity led by Khan Edmund 'Grassshaker' Ha’thris.

nations.name: Kiltkoy Bush Empire
nations.description: Imperial polity ruled by Chief Raymont Sayghed Dumas.

nations.name: Sam-Sufal Imperium
nations.description: Imperial state ruled by Prince Stevanius and later regented by Raymont.

nations.name: Revolutionary Commonwealth of Montague
nations.description: Breakaway revolutionary polity in Drezbaeryn formerly aligned with the State Government.

regions.name: Drezbaeryn
regions.description: Post-Collapse name for the region once known as Brisbane, home to many successor polities.

regions.name: Weset
regions.description: Region fought over by the State Government, City Council, independent gangs, micro-countries, and the Revolutionary Commonwealth of Montague.

regions.name: Norman
regions.description: Region in Drezbaeryn fought over by several native polities and both the State Government and City Council.

regions.name: Virgin Bush
regions.description: General term for bushland not inhabited by agricultural peoples, lying between the Commonwealth and the Gappe.

regions.name: K’oota
regions.description: Region inhabited by related but distinct tribal groups including the Trail Hunters and Hill Sliders.

regions.name: D’aug
regions.description: Mountainous homeland of the Halphadites, west of the Kiltkoy heartland.

regions.name: Khuljin
regions.description: Remote corner of the Drezbaeryn river where the O’Ryentari civilization formed.

regions.name: Tuwinbin
regions.description: Region where the Sidentius civilization formed after a hundred-year war.

regions.name: Old Brookton
regions.description: Region south of the Commonwealth border, surrendered after tribal attacks following the Gappe War.

factions.name: State Government of Drezbaeryn
factions.description: Loose successor to the pre-Collapse state government, maintaining draft, democratic institutions, and rule of law.

factions.name: City Council Government of Drezbaeryn
factions.description: Successor to the pre-Collapse city council, attracting fewer but stronger communities capable of independent defence.

factions.name: Ironlords
factions.description: Multiple groups who extract iron through labour or raiding and trade it away; often violent and semi-nomadic.

factions.name: Twelve Tribes of Indros
factions.description: Unified confederation of pre-Collapse gangs controlling relics and the Great Indropolis shopping centre.

factions.name: The Boys
factions.description: Gang originating from a pre-Collapse all-boys private school, seeking domination and subjugation.

factions.name: Southriver Interests Fellowship
factions.description: Political party representing Southriver economic interests, advocating economic freedom and state rights.

factions.name: Chapters of Jindu
factions.description: Small squads of 5–30 people working in commerce and craftsmanship, forming the backbone of Jindu’s economy.

factions.name: Guilds of Jindu
factions.description: Organisations specialising in particular crafts or services, employing Chapters and negotiating with Houses.

factions.name: Houses of Jindu
factions.description: Descendants of centre management and new elites controlling major buildings, property, and private armies.

factions.name: Trail Hunters
factions.description: Ko’ota tribal group associated with the Gappe trail, semi-nomadic and involved in post-Gappe War territorial changes.

factions.name: Hill Sliders
factions.description: Ko’ota tribal group that annexed the Gappe trail and parts of Chapil after the Gappe War.

factions.name: 1st Royal North Brigade
factions.description: Composite brigade formed from Khymoer, Moggin, Jindus, and Indros battalions to invade the Gappe.

factions.name: 4th Royal Dragoons
factions.description: Cavalry core of the 1st Royal North Brigade, responsible for reconnaissance and logistics.

cultures.name: Tribal Hair Honour Code
cultures.description: Men grow their hair long, cutting only to promote growth. Hair is cut as punishment for defeat or submission and woven into communal rope.

cultures.name: Hair Fire Rituals
cultures.description: Hair that cannot be woven into rope is stored and burned as firestarter, symbolising spiritual release of service.

cultures.name: Classical and Modern English
cultures.description: Classical English preserves 19th–20th century grammar and spelling; Modern English is a family of related languages with divergent vocabularies.

cultures.name: Modern Name Evolution
cultures.description: Modern English names descend from Classical forms: Jehannya from John, Loyye from Lloyd, Daruwes from Gareth, Izwar from Ivan, Milron from Miles.

cultures.name: Catholic as Orthodoxy
cultures.description: The word 'Catholic' shifted from meaning allegiance to the Pope to a general term for orthodoxy in Drezbaeryn’s syncretic Christian traditions.

cultures.name: Ryenarkian Tradition and Legalism
cultures.description: Ryenarkian society emphasises tradition, religion, and connections, with increasing legal codification under Darian’s reforms.

religions.name: Muqadas Prophets’ Cosmology
religions.description: Belief that the universe cycles eternally through Qynyt (Piety), Ghatrasa (Arrogance), and Alkarith (Cataclysm). Reincarnation is eternal and destiny inescapable.

religions.name: Muqadas-Shajara
religions.description: Sacred text and lineage record of the Cult of Altajdid, containing histories and teachings of prophets from Luyid onward.

religions.name: Cult of Altajdid
religions.description: State religion of the Ryenarkian Empire, centred on prophetic succession (Shajareth) and the Muqadas-Shajara.

characters.name: Darian the Smiter
characters.role: High Emperor of the Ryenarkian Empire
characters.description: Anointed High Emperor who reformed Ryenarkian legalism, expanded imperial authority, and enforced prophetic orthodoxy.

characters.name: Luyid
characters.role: Prophet and founder of the Sidentius civilization
characters.description: Reincarnated prophet whose followers migrated west to Tuwinbin after a hundred-year war.

characters.name: Izwar
characters.role: Prophet and founder of the O’Ryentari civilization
characters.description: Eastern prophet whose teachings shaped the Khuljin region and the O’Ryentari identity.

characters.name: Edmund 'Grassshaker' Ha’thris
characters.description: Leader of the Halphadite Khanate, known for cavalry warfare and mountain campaigns.

characters.name: Raymont Sayghed Dumas
characters.role: Chief of the Kiltkoy Bush Empire and Regent of Sam-Sufal
characters.description: Feudal ruler who expanded influence over Sam-Sufal through regency and political manoeuvring.

characters.name: Prince Stevanius
characters.description: Nominal ruler of Sam-Sufal whose authority was overshadowed by Raymont’s regency.

characters.name: Milron
characters.description: Chronicler of the Muqadas-Shajara and genealogies of the prophetic line.

characters.name: Daruwes
characters.description: Officer known for discipline and loyalty during the Gappe War.

characters.name: Jehannya
characters.description: Responsible for supply chains during the Commonwealth’s northern campaigns.

characters.name: Loyye
characters.description: Expert bush tracker who served as a guide during the Gappe War.

timeline.name: Era of the Prophets
timeline.description: Period marked by the lives and teachings of Luyid, Izwar, and other early prophets whose movements shaped later civilizations.

timeline.name: Hundred-Year War
timeline.description: Century-long conflict that preceded the Sidentius migration to Tuwinbin under the prophet Luyid.

timeline.name: The Collapse
timeline.description: Global systemic failure that ended the pre-Collapse world and gave rise to successor polities in Drezbaeryn and beyond.

timeline.name: Post-Collapse Formation Period
timeline.description: Era in which the State Government, City Council, Commonwealth, and other successor states emerged from the ruins of the old world.

timeline.name: Gappe War
timeline.description: Conflict between the Commonwealth and the Gappe, resulting in the annexation of the Gappe trail by the Hill Sliders and Trail Hunters.

timeline.name: Unification of Indros
timeline.description: Period when the Twelve Tribes of Indros unified under a confederation, consolidating control over the Great Indropolis.

timeline.name: Drezbaeryn Conflicts
timeline.description: Series of overlapping conflicts in Weset and Norman involving the State Government, City Council, gangs, and micro-states.

encyclopedia.name: Great Indropolis
encyclopedia.description: Massive pre-Collapse shopping centre now controlled by the Twelve Tribes of Indros, serving as a fortified economic and political hub.

encyclopedia.name: Gappe Trail
encyclopedia.description: Critical trade and migration route connecting the Gappe to Ko’ota lands; annexed by Hill Sliders and Trail Hunters after the Gappe War.

encyclopedia.name: Chapil
encyclopedia.description: Region partially annexed by the Hill Sliders following the Gappe War, formerly under Gappe influence.

encyclopedia.name: Khymoer
encyclopedia.description: Capital of the Commonwealth of the Westrealms and administrative centre of the northern brigades.

encyclopedia.name: Moggin
encyclopedia.description: Commonwealth city contributing battalions to the 1st Royal North Brigade.

encyclopedia.name: Jindus
encyclopedia.description: Commercial city whose Chapters and Guilds form a major part of the Commonwealth’s economic engine.

encyclopedia.name: Indros
encyclopedia.description: Urban centre dominated by the Twelve Tribes, built around the Great Indropolis.

encyclopedia.name: Ko’ota Homelands
encyclopedia.description: Homelands of the Ko’ota peoples, including the Trail Hunters and Hill Sliders, known for rugged bush terrain.

encyclopedia.name: Drezbaeryn River System
encyclopedia.description: River network forming the heartland of the Ryenarkian Empire and several successor polities.

encyclopedia.name: Prophetic Genealogies
encyclopedia.description: Lineage records preserved in the Muqadas-Shajara, tracing the succession of prophets from Luyid onward.

artifacts.name: Muqadas-Shajara Codex
artifacts.description: Primary sacred record of the Cult of Altajdid, containing genealogies, teachings, and historical accounts of the prophetic line.

artifacts.name: Woven Hair Rope
artifacts.description: Communal rope woven from the hair of defeated warriors or penitents, symbolising submission, honour, and communal memory.

artifacts.name: Ironlord Forge Relics
artifacts.description: Tools, blades, and iron ingots produced or captured by Ironlord groups, used as currency and symbols of dominance.

artifacts.name: Indropolis Relic Keys
artifacts.description: Ancient pre-Collapse access keys used by the Twelve Tribes to control sealed sections of the Great Indropolis.

artifacts.name: Commonwealth Campaign Banners
artifacts.description: Regimental banners carried by Commonwealth brigades during the Gappe War and northern campaigns.
